required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating Anatomic Versus Targeted Lead Placement for Burst Stimulation Therapy During the Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Controlled, Single Blind, Prospective, Multicenter Study Evaluating Anatomic Versus Targeted Lead Placement for BurstDR Therapy During the Trial Evaluation Period. (DELIVERY)

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective, multi-center, randomized, single blind study

detailed_description.textblock:
This clinical investigation compares success rates for anatomically placed leads to conventional, targeted lead placement for BurstDR™ during the trial evaluation period with the St Jude Medical™ Invisible Trial System. Subjects will be blinded to treatment group and randomized in a 1:1 ratio as follows:
Group 1 (AB): anatomic lead placement followed by BurstDR™ stimulation during an initial trial evaluation period Group 2 (TB): targeted lead placement followed by BurstDR™ stimulation during an initial trial evaluation period
If the subject qualifies for permanent system implant according to pre-defined criteria after the initial trial evaluation period, the subject will exit the clinical investigation and continue their treatment per the physician's standard of care. Subjects who do not qualify for permanent system implant according to pre-defined criteria after the initial trial evaluation period may participate in an extended trial evaluation period, per physician discretion, during which they will be programmed with tonic stimulation. Subjects continuing to an extended trial evaluation period will be followed through the completion of the extended trial period. At the end of the extended trial evaluation period, subjects will exit the clinical investigation.

primary_outcome.measure: Qualification Rate for Permanent System Implant at the End of the Initial Trial Evaluation Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: From pre-implant to end of initial trial evaluation period, 3 to 5 days of BurstDR stimulation
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint is the qualification rate for permanent system implant at the end of the initial trial evaluation period. Qualification for permanent system implant was defined by a composite where all the following conditions were met: ≥ 50% patient reported pain relief (PRP) at the end of the trial evaluation Trial evaluation period lasted for a minimum of 3 days Physician recommends subject for permanent system implant Subject reports a willingness to pursue a permanent system implant Subjects did not qualify for permanent system implant if they met both of the following: < 50% PRP (patient reported pain relief) at the end of the trial evaluation Trial evaluation period lasted for a minimum of 5 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Physician Preference for Anatomic Placement Versus Targeted Placement at the End of the Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From pre-implant to end of initial trial evaluation period, 3 to 5 days of BurstDR stimulation
secondary_outcome.description: The physician preference for placement of leads was noted by giving them the option of choosing which lead placement technique they preferred - anatomic or targeted lead placement technique.

other_outcome.measure: Procedural Characteristics of Subjects With One Trial Lead Implanted (US)
other_outcome.description: Procedural characteristics including overall procedure time (room-in to room-out, implant procedure time (needle-in to needle-out, and the intraoperative time for the fluoroscopy procedure were measured.

other_outcome.measure: Procedural Characteristics of Subjects With One Trial Lead Implanted (OUS)
other_outcome.description: Procedural characteristics including overall procedure time (room-in to room-out, implant procedure time (needle-in to needle-out, and the intraoperative time for the fluoroscopy procedure were measured.

other_outcome.measure: Procedural Characteristics of Subjects With One Trial Lead Implanted (Worldwide)
other_outcome.description: Procedural characteristics including overall procedure time (room-in to room-out, implant procedure time (needle-in to needle-out, and the intraoperative time for the fluoroscopy procedure were measured.

other_outcome.measure: Procedural Characteristics of Subjects With Two Trial Leads Implanted (US)
other_outcome.description: Procedural characteristics including overall procedure time (room-in to room-out, implant procedure time (needle-in to needle-out, and the intraoperative time for the fluoroscopy procedure were measured.

other_outcome.measure: Procedural Characteristics of Subjects With Two Trial Leads Implanted (OUS)
other_outcome.description: Procedural characteristics including overall procedure time (room-in to room-out, implant procedure time (needle-in to needle-out, and the intraoperative time for the fluoroscopy procedure were measured.

other_outcome.measure: Procedural Characteristics of Subjects With Two Trial Leads Implanted (Worldwide)
other_outcome.description: Procedural characteristics including overall procedure time (room-in to room-out, implant procedure time (needle-in to needle-out, and the intraoperative time for the fluoroscopy procedure were measured.

other_outcome.measure: Procedural Characteristics of Subjects With One Permanent Lead Implanted (OUS)
other_outcome.description: Procedural characteristics including overall procedure time (room-in to room-out, implant procedure time (needle-in to needle-out, and the intraoperative time for the fluoroscopy procedure were measured.

other_outcome.measure: Procedural Characteristics of Subjects With Two Permanent Leads Implanted (OUS)
other_outcome.description: Procedural characteristics including overall procedure time (room-in to room-out, implant procedure time (needle-in to needle-out, and the intraoperative time for the fluoroscopy procedure were measured.

other_outcome.measure: Programming Time Needed for Each Randomized Group
other_outcome.description: The programming time observed for both randomized groups

other_outcome.measure: Change From Pre-implant Numerical Rating Scale (NRS) in Each Randomized Group to End of Initial Trial Evaluation Period
other_outcome.time_frame: From pre-implant to end of initial trial evaluation period, 3 to 5 days of BurstDR stimulation
other_outcome.description: Subjects were interviewed using the pain NRS scale consisting of 1 question and were asked to rate their average pain specific to the area(s) of chronic pain being treated over the past 24 hours on a 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst imaginable pain) scale. A higher score indicates a higher pain level.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Pre-implant Numerical Rating Scale (NRS) in Each Randomized Group to the End of the Extended Trial Evaluation Period
other_outcome.time_frame: From pre-implant to end of extended trial period, a minimum of 5 days BurstDR stimulation plus an additional minimum of 3 days tonic stimulation
other_outcome.description: Subjects were interviewed using the pain NRS scale consisting of 1 question and were asked to rate their average pain specific to the area(s) of chronic pain being treated over the past 24 hours on a 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst imaginable pain) scale. A higher score indicates a higher pain level.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Have Affirmative Assessment for Each of the Independent Criteria Required for Qualification for Permanent Implant
other_outcome.time_frame: From pre-implant to end of initial trial evaluation period, 3 to 5 days of BurstDR stimulation
other_outcome.description: Number of subjects in each randomized group who have affirmative assessment for each of the independent criteria required for qualification for permanent implant

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects Who do Not Qualify for Permanent Implant But Proceeded With Permanent Implant Per Physician Discretion.
other_outcome.time_frame: From pre-implant to end of initial trial evaluation period, 3 to 5 days of BurstDR stimulation
other_outcome.description: Number of subjects in each randomized group who do not qualify for permanent implant but proceeded with permanent implant per physician discretion.

other_outcome.measure: Time From Trial System to ≥ 50% Patient Reported Pain Relief (PRP)
other_outcome.time_frame: From pre-implant to end of initial trial evaluation period, 3 to 5 days of BurstDR stimulation
other_outcome.description: Time from trial system to ≥ 50% patient reported pain relief measured by the number of days (also known as " wash-in period")

other_outcome.measure: Rate of Serious Adverse Device Effects (SADE) Based on Randomization
other_outcome.time_frame: From pre-implant to exit of the study, approximately 3 to 14 days
other_outcome.description: Rate of serious adverse device effects based on each randomized group.

other_outcome.measure: Number and Proportion of Meaningful Lead Migrations During the Initial Trial Evaluation Periods by Treatment Group
other_outcome.time_frame: From pre-implant to end of initial trial evaluation period, 3 to 5 days of BurstDR stimulation
other_outcome.description: A meaningful lead migration is defined as a lead migration resulting in the inability to program for therapeutic response

other_outcome.measure: Number and Proportion of Meaningful Lead Migrations During Initial Trial Evaluation Period by Lead Type
other_outcome.time_frame: From pre-implant to end of initial trial evaluation period, 3 to 5 days of BurstDR stimulation
other_outcome.description: The number and proportion of meaningful lead migrations during initial trial evaluation period was assessed based on lead type (either Temporary Lead Implant or Permanent Lead Implant). A meaningful lead migration is defined as a lead migration resulting in the inability to program for therapeutic response

other_outcome.measure: Clinician Assessment of Anesthesia Related Difficulty and Lead Placement Difficulty
other_outcome.description: Clinician assessment of anesthesia related difficulty and lead placement difficulty using a Likert scale ranging from ' No difficulty' to extreme difficulty and clinician affinity for lead placement technique at the end of the trial implant procedure.

other_outcome.measure: Clinician Affinity for Lead Placement Technique at the End of Trial Procedure
other_outcome.description: Clinician affinity for lead placement technique at the end of the trial implant procedure using a Likert scale ranging from 0 being 'Not all' to 4 being ' very much'.

other_outcome.measure: Permanent System Qualification Rate at the End of Extended Trial Period
other_outcome.time_frame: From pre-implant to end of extended trial period, a minimum of 5 days BurstDR stimulation plus an additional minimum of 3 days tonic stimulation
other_outcome.description: The qualification rate for permanent implant was calculated for the subjects who completed the extended trial period.

clinical_study.condition: Chronic, Intractable Pain of the Trunk and/or Lower Limbs

arm_group.description: Group 1 (AB): anatomic lead placement followed by BurstDR™ stimulation during an initial trial evaluation period
Group 2 (TB): targeted lead placement followed by BurstDR™ stimulation during an initial trial evaluation period

intervention.intervention_name: lead placement followed by BurstDR stimulation
intervention.description: lead placement followed by BurstDR stimulation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patient indicated for Spinal Cord Stimulation therapy in accordance with the approved labeling.
2. Patient's pain profile indicates appropriate lead placement would be at one or more levels from T7 to T10, to achieve pain coverage.
3. Patient has a baseline score on the Numerical Rating Scale ≥6 over the past 24 hours for 'average overall pain'specific to the area(s) of chronic pain that will be treated with spinal cord stimulation.
4. Patient is considered by the Study Investigator as a candidate for implantation of a spinal cord stimulator system according to the system Instructions for Use.
5. Patient is >18 years of age at the time of enrollment.
6. Patient is willing to adhere to the study requirements, including compliance with and completion of all study visits.
7. Patient has signed and received a copy of the Ethical Committee/Independent Review Board approved informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patient currently has a spinal cord stimulation system implanted.
2. Patient has previously failed a spinal cord stimulation therapy (either trial system evaluation or permanent system implant).
3. Patient has a primary diagnosis of Peripheral Vascular Disease (PVD), Angina Pectoris, or Chronic Migraine.
4. Patient is scheduled to undergo an on-the-table trial evaluation (aka all-in-one procedure)
5. Patient is scheduled to be implanted with (a) surgical paddle trial lead(s).

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The subject enrollment for the DELIVERY study began on 22 September 2017, at 23 clinical sites in the United States, Europe, and Australia. A total of 270 subjects were randomized into the two treatment groups (Anatomic Lead Placement and Targeted lead placement).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 288 subjects were screened, of which 18 subjects were withdrawn before randomization due to unmet inclusion/exclusion criteria (n=6), withdrawal of the consent (n=11) and subject was on the clinic's wait list to receive an implant only after the study closed (n=1). The last follow-up visit occurred on 27 August 2018.

outcome.title: Qualification Rate for Permanent System Implant at the End of the Initial Trial Evaluation Period
outcome.description: The primary endpoint is the qualification rate for permanent system implant at the end of the initial trial evaluation period. Qualification for permanent system implant was defined by a composite where all the following conditions were met: ≥ 50% patient reported pain relief (PRP) at the end of the trial evaluation Trial evaluation period lasted for a minimum of 3 days Physician recommends subject for permanent system implant Subject reports a willingness to pursue a permanent system implant Subjects did not qualify for permanent system implant if they met both of the following: < 50% PRP (patient reported pain relief) at the end of the trial evaluation Trial evaluation period lasted for a minimum of 5 days

outcome.population: The number of participants analyzed includes subjects who were available at that time of analysis

group.title: Group 2 (TB)
group.description: Group 2 (TB): targeted lead placement followed by BurstDR™ stimulation during an initial trial evaluation period

measure.title: Qualification Rate for Permanent System Implant at the End of the Initial Trial Evaluation Period
measure.description: The primary endpoint is the qualification rate for permanent system implant at the end of the initial trial evaluation period. Qualification for permanent system implant was defined by a composite where all the following conditions were met: ≥ 50% patient reported pain relief (PRP) at the end of the trial evaluation Trial evaluation period lasted for a minimum of 3 days Physician recommends subject for permanent system implant Subject reports a willingness to pursue a permanent system implant Subjects did not qualify for permanent system implant if they met both of the following: < 50% PRP (patient reported pain relief) at the end of the trial evaluation Trial evaluation period lasted for a minimum of 5 days
measure.population: The number of participants analyzed includes subjects who were available at that time of analysis

analysis.groups_desc: The hypothesis was formally addressed as: H0: AB - TB ≤ -15% H1: AB - TB > -15% where AB = permanent system qualification rate of Group 1 (AB) TB = permanent system qualification rate of Group 2 (TB)
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The hypothesis was tested at the 5% significance level.

outcome.title: Rate of Physician Preference for Anatomic Placement Versus Targeted Placement at the End of the Study
outcome.description: The physician preference for placement of leads was noted by giving them the option of choosing which lead placement technique they preferred - anatomic or targeted lead placement technique.
outcome.time_frame: From pre-implant to end of initial trial evaluation period, 3 to 5 days of BurstDR stimulation
outcome.population: The analysis population included physicians who had performed both types of lead placement procedures.

group.title: Physicians Who Prefer Anatomic Lead Placement
group.description: Physicians who preferred anatomic placement of leads

group.title: Physicians Who Prefer Targeted Placement of Leads
group.description: Physicians who prefered targeted placement of leads

measure.title: Rate of Physician Preference for Anatomic Placement Versus Targeted Placement at the End of the Study
measure.description: The physician preference for placement of leads was noted by giving them the option of choosing which lead placement technique they preferred - anatomic or targeted lead placement technique.
measure.population: The analysis population included physicians who had performed both types of lead placement procedures.

analysis.groups_desc: The hypothesis was formally addressed as: H0: P ≤ 60% H1: P > 60% where P= percentage of physician prefer anatomic placement over targeted placement. The analysis population included physicians who have performed both placement procedures. The hypothesis was tested at the 5% significance level.

outcome.population: Subjects include those who had one trial lead implanted in sites in the United States.

measure.population: The number of participants analyzed includes subjects who were available at that time of analysis

outcome.title: Rate of Serious Adverse Device Effects (SADE) Based on Randomization
outcome.description: Rate of serious adverse device effects based on each randomized group.
outcome.time_frame: From pre-implant to exit of the study, approximately 3 to 14 days
outcome.population: The number of participants analyzed includes subjects who were available at that time of analysis

group.title: Group 1 (AB)
group.description: Group 1 (AB): anatomic lead placement followed by BurstDR™ stimulation during an initial trial evaluation period

group.title: Group 2 (TB)
group.description: Group 2 (TB): targeted lead placement followed by BurstDR™ stimulation during an initial trial evaluation period

measure.title: Rate of Serious Adverse Device Effects (SADE) Based on Randomization
measure.description: Rate of serious adverse device effects based on each randomized group.
measure.population: The number of participants analyzed includes subjects who were available at that time of analysis

outcome.title: Number and Proportion of Meaningful Lead Migrations During the Initial Trial Evaluation Periods by Treatment Group
outcome.description: A meaningful lead migration is defined as a lead migration resulting in the inability to program for therapeutic response
outcome.time_frame: From pre-implant to end of initial trial evaluation period, 3 to 5 days of BurstDR stimulation
outcome.population: The number of participants analyzed includes subjects who were available at that time of analysis

group.title: Group 1 (AB)
group.description: Group 1 (AB): anatomic lead placement followed by BurstDR™ stimulation during an initial trial evaluation period

group.title: Group 2 (TB)
group.description: Group 2 (TB): targeted lead placement followed by BurstDR™ stimulation during an initial trial evaluation period

measure.title: Number and Proportion of Meaningful Lead Migrations During the Initial Trial Evaluation Periods by Treatment Group
measure.description: A meaningful lead migration is defined as a lead migration resulting in the inability to program for therapeutic response
measure.population: The number of participants analyzed includes subjects who were available at that time of analysis

outcome.title: Number and Proportion of Meaningful Lead Migrations During Initial Trial Evaluation Period by Lead Type
outcome.description: The number and proportion of meaningful lead migrations during initial trial evaluation period was assessed based on lead type (either Temporary Lead Implant or Permanent Lead Implant). A meaningful lead migration is defined as a lead migration resulting in the inability to program for therapeutic response
outcome.time_frame: From pre-implant to end of initial trial evaluation period, 3 to 5 days of BurstDR stimulation
outcome.population: The number of participants analyzed includes subjects who were available at that time of analysis

group.title: Subjects With Temporary Lead Implant
group.description: Subjects who had temporary lead implant after randomization

group.title: Subjects With Permanent Lead Implant
group.description: Subjects who had Permanent lead implant after randomization

measure.title: Number and Proportion of Meaningful Lead Migrations During Initial Trial Evaluation Period by Lead Type
measure.description: The number and proportion of meaningful lead migrations during initial trial evaluation period was assessed based on lead type (either Temporary Lead Implant or Permanent Lead Implant). A meaningful lead migration is defined as a lead migration resulting in the inability to program for therapeutic response
measure.population: The number of participants analyzed includes subjects who were available at that time of analysis

outcome.title: Clinician Assessment of Anesthesia Related Difficulty and Lead Placement Difficulty
outcome.description: Clinician assessment of anesthesia related difficulty and lead placement difficulty using a Likert scale ranging from ' No difficulty' to extreme difficulty and clinician affinity for lead placement technique at the end of the trial implant procedure.
outcome.time_frame: Trial system implant
outcome.population: The number of participants analyzed includes subjects who were available at that time of analysis

group.title: Group 1 (AB)
group.description: Group 1 (AB): anatomic lead placement followed by BurstDR™ stimulation during an initial trial evaluation period

group.title: Group 2 (TB)
group.description: Group 2 (TB): targeted lead placement followed by BurstDR™ stimulation during an initial trial evaluation period

measure.title: Clinician Assessment of Anesthesia Related Difficulty and Lead Placement Difficulty
measure.description: Clinician assessment of anesthesia related difficulty and lead placement difficulty using a Likert scale ranging from ' No difficulty' to extreme difficulty and clinician affinity for lead placement technique at the end of the trial implant procedure.
measure.population: The number of participants analyzed includes subjects who were available at that time of analysis

outcome.title: Clinician Affinity for Lead Placement Technique at the End of Trial Procedure
outcome.description: Clinician affinity for lead placement technique at the end of the trial implant procedure using a Likert scale ranging from 0 being 'Not all' to 4 being ' very much'.
outcome.time_frame: Trial system implant
outcome.population: The number of participants analyzed includes subjects who were available at that time of analysis

group.description: Group 2 (TB): targeted lead placement followed by BurstDR™ stimulation during an initial trial evaluation period

measure.title: Clinician Affinity for Lead Placement Technique at the End of Trial Procedure
measure.description: Clinician affinity for lead placement technique at the end of the trial implant procedure using a Likert scale ranging from 0 being 'Not all' to 4 being ' very much'.
measure.population: The number of participants analyzed includes subjects who were available at that time of analysis

outcome.title: Permanent System Qualification Rate at the End of Extended Trial Period
outcome.description: The qualification rate for permanent implant was calculated for the subjects who completed the extended trial period.
outcome.time_frame: From pre-implant to end of extended trial period, a minimum of 5 days BurstDR stimulation plus an additional minimum of 3 days tonic stimulation
outcome.population: The number of participants analyzed includes subjects who were available at that time of analysis

group.title: Group 1 (AB)
group.description: Group 1 (AB): anatomic lead placement followed by BurstDR™ stimulation during an initial trial evaluation period

group.title: Group 2 (TB)

measure.title: Permanent System Qualification Rate at the End of Extended Trial Period
measure.description: The qualification rate for permanent implant was calculated for the subjects who completed the extended trial period.
measure.population: The number of participants analyzed includes subjects who were available at that time of analysis

event.sub_title: Unpleasant sensations or Motor disturbances Including Involuntary Movement caused by high output
New leg pain on walking instead of original dysaesthetic sensation

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The study was designed to collect data during the initial trial period only. Anatomic placement of leads may not provide adequate paresthesia coverage for patients wishing to periodically use a paresthesia-based stimulation design.
